arts.ttl: Mark Robins makes big admission after Coventry City fail to turn up
arts.sum: Mark Robins held his hands up and admitted he picked the wrong Coventry City team to face Swansea while accusing his players of failing to carry out his instructions. The Sky Blues boss kept faith with the ten outfield players who performed so well against Tottenham on Wednesday night but the decision back-fired on the manager as City fell woefully short against a well-drilled and hungry looking opposition who took control with a two goal lead in the opening 32 minutes at the CBS Arena.

arts.ttl: I’ve picked the wrong team – Mark Robins apologises for Coventry defeat
Swansea City secure all three points against Coventry City in gutsy display
arts.sum: Goals from Liam Cullen and Ollie Cooper handed Swansea City a 2-1 win in the east Midlands

arts.ttl: Coventry City player ratings after Sky Blues made to pay for dreadful first half showing - Andy Turner
arts.sum: City then backed off Oliver Cooper whose shot took a deflection off Victor Torp to beat Oliver Dovin at his near post as the visitors doubled their lead just after the half hour mark. Forced to make an early save at his near post as the Swans took the game to City, with the keeper beaten by Cullen from eight yards in only the eighth minute.

arts.ttl: Liam Cullen on scoresheet as Swansea secure first away win at Coventry
Mark Robins makes one change to Coventry City's team to face Swansea
arts.sum: City: Oliver Dovin; Milan van Ewijk, Bobby Thomas, Luis Binks, Jake Bidwell; Josh Eccles, Jamie Allen; Brandon Thomas-Asante, Jack Rudoni, Haji Wright; Norman Bassette. Get the latest Coventry City news sent straight to your phone by joining our Sky Blues WhatsApp group.

arts.ttl: Coventry City boss addresses boo-boy backlash and gives insight to what he has 'lived through' with Doug King
arts.sum: “This is what I have experienced and lived through with him," said Robins, when asked if it’s fair to say that the club is almost unrecognisable since the new owner came in, in terms what he’s done on and off the pitch, from transforming the training ground to a top class facility to strengthening and reinvesting wisely in the squad. We have now got players in the building who we can develop and utilise to try to get to where we want to get to, and the ultimate aim is obviously to get into the play-offs or better in a division where it’s notoriously difficult to do.

arts.ttl: Why Mark Robins is so 'excited' about Coventry City teen set to be 'real asset' for club
arts.sum: He’s another effervescent character and once he starts to speak English... Still only 19, the Belgian centre-forward played with confidence beyond his years, with his blistering pace, chances on goal and an assist for Brandon Thomas-Asante to give the Sky Blues the lead giving manager Mark Robins plenty of food for thought ahead of Saturday’s CBS Arena clash with Swansea City.

arts.ttl: Competition hots up after Tottenham thriller - Coventry City predicted team v Swansea - Andy Turner - CoventryLive
arts.sum: Predicted City team to face Swansea: Oliver Dovin; Milan van Ewijk, Bobby Thomas, Luis Binks, Jake Bidwell; Josh Eccles, Jamie Allen; Brandon Thomas-Asante, Jack Rudoni, Haji Wright; Ellis Simms. Mark Robins made seven changes to his Coventry City team to face Tottenham in the Carabao Cup on Wednesday when every one of those players gave the manager food for thought ahead of Saturday's return to Championship action, with bogey side Swansea the visitors to the CBS Arena (3pm kick-off).

arts.ttl: How latest Coventry City prospect earned place on the bench against Tottenham
arts.sum: “It gives you an understanding of where you can get to if you put the work in and listen and work hard like James has done at the football club,” said the manager. Robins says he learned from his own experience as a young striker breaking through at Old Trafford under Sir Alex Ferguson, that young players often need to be given time to flourish.
